newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures close lower in all months.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures close lower in all months.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures closed lower in all months on Thursday, reflecting price gains on the CBOT corn market overnight, traders said.
Prices were 60 to 200 yen lower at the close, and benchmark November was down 90 yen at 13,610 yen per tonne. Daily volume was 41,461 lots.
Buying by individual investors, who were encouraged by price gains in Chicago, emerged from the opening, traders said.
But they said most participants hesitated to trade actively ahead of the USDA's crop report to be announced later in the day.
The spot December contract on the CBOT Project A trading system was being traded at $2.67-1/2 per bushel at 0805 GMT, steady from Wednesday's close.
The spot January contract of CBOT soybean futures on the overnight trading system was at $6.92 per bushel at 0805 GMT, against $6.91-1/2 at Wednesday's close.
